TEST* _add_new_test ( PROBLEM *  problem,
const char *  description,
void(*)()  test_function,
TEST **  list 
)

Add a new test to a given problem, a problem is a collection of tests; This is not the function that is called by the test program, this is an internal function.

Parameters:
problem the problem to which to add the test
description the description of the problem
test_function the function that the test will call
list the test list to add the test to
Returns:
the test that is created

size_t  size,
const char *  msg 
)

Calloc the requested memory or exit the program.

Parameters:
num the number of units to index
size the size of a given unit
msg the message to print if the calloc fails

Add a new manual grade, this is the system function, not called by the grading program; not thread safe.

char* _pstype_to_str ( PS_TYPE  type  ) 

Gets the string of the problem set type from a PS_TYPE object.

Parameters:
type the PS_TYPE object to decode; returns a string based on this
Returns:
"homework" if type is a HOMEWORK, "exam" if type is a EXAM, "lab" if type is a LAB

char *  append_str

void add_manual_grade ( PROBLEM *  problem,
const char *  description,
int  points,
BOOL  is_extra_credit 
)

Add a manual grade to the given problem.

A manual grade is a grade you enter at the keyboard, not tested by the comp

Parameters:
problem the problem to add the manual grade to
description a description of the manual grade
points the points associated with this manual grade
is_extra_credit is this manual grade extra credit?

void add_new_ec_test ( PROBLEM *  problem,
const char *  description,
double  points,
void(*)()  test_function 
)

Add a new extra credit to the given problem, given the function to test.

Parameters:
problem the problem to which to add the test
description a description of the test to add to the problem
points the number of extra credit points to attribute to the test
test_function the function that is called and associated with this test

void run_tests ( PROBLEM *  problem,
long  late_ts,
_STRBUF *  xml_buffer 
)

Run all the tests, passing the first problem in the linked list to the tester; Not thread safe.

Parameters:
problem the first problem in the PROBLEM linked list
late_ts The late timestamp, in unix epoch time
xml_buffer the string buffer to print the xml output

void set_comments ( PROBLEM *  problem,
BOOL  set 
)

Set whether or not this problem has comments, the value of set is set to has_comments.

Parameters:
problem the problem to set if there are comments
set TRUE if the problem does have comments, FALSE if it does not

char* str_replace ( char *  string,
char *  search,
char *  replace 
)

Replaces instances of the search string with the replace string in 'string'; Written By - Lehner Franz (franz@caos.at) 2002.

Parameters:
string the string to do the operation on
search the string to search for
replace the string to replace the first string with
Returns:
return the edited string

Replaces '<' and '>' in the xml docs so the xml does not crash.

Parameters:

Returns:
